description.narrative:
This project will have a high development impact considering that microfinance has been shown to play a major positive role in reducing poverty and unemployment in developing countries. The initiative will strengthen the leading microfinance institution in Rwanda by financing the companys planned portfolio growth and expansion. The initiative will also develop the Rwandan local currency swap market as one of, if not the, first swapped IFC loan into Rwandan Francs.
Development impact will be measured on the basis of financial and operational performance of the institution, its expanded product offer and outreach, and adherence to sound corporate and social governance (including environmental compliance).

Urwego Opportunity Bank of Rwanda (UOB) is a licensed microfinance bank with a nation-wide outreach in Rwanda. The project objective is to provide local currency liquidity in support of UOBs growing loan portfolio while the bank continues to expand the deposit volume and deposit taking branch network.
The project consists of local currency debt of up to RWF 2.0 Billion (equivalent to approximately $3.5 Million) and will make use of the recently signed swap counterparty agreement between IFC and the National Bank of Rwanda.
